snippet: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton struggled to explain how they would handle the war, but both broke from their allies....
abstract: Donald J Trump and Hillary Clinton both wrestle during second presidential debate with question of how they would deal with five-year-old Syrian civil war; Trump expresses disagreement with his running mate Gov Mike Pence, who had made pledge for airstrikes in effort to counter Russia's actions in Syria; Clinton wants to set no-fly zone over Syria, move opposed by Pres Obama.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump and Hillary Clinton struggled to explain how they would handle the war, but both broke from their allies.

headline.main: In Debate on Syria, It’s Trump vs. Pence, and Clinton vs. Obama
headline.print_headline: Debate Exposed Intraparty Divides on Syria, and the Shrinking U.S. Options

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
